questions.question: ‘I haven’t got a ticket.’ ‘………………………….. have I.’
You are …………………………… generous.
questions.description: We do not use so much to modify adjectives and adverbs.

questions.question: Start at once, so that you …………………………… there by noon.
I want to stay for …………………………. two weeks.
questions.description: We can use another with plural expressions of quantity.

questions.question: I visit my parents every …………………………..
questions.description: Every can be used before plural expressions in measurements of frequency.

questions.question: My ……………………………… sent to Paris by mistake.
questions.description: Baggage does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Alice and James ……………………………. going to be late.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by and, the verb is singular.

questions.question: The Prime Minister as well as his ministers ………………………….. tough financial measures.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Ten people lost ………………………………… in the accident.
A number of people …………………………… to buy cars.
questions.description: Plural verbs are common after a number of.

questions.question: Two thousand dollars ………………………… a large sum.
The team ……………………………. going to lose.
questions.description: In British English, collective nouns can be used with either singular or plural verbs in American English, singular verbs are preferred.
